website_summaries.verdict: Reidel was the first company to come up with glasses specifically for the fuller-bodied oaked chardonnay.
pros: The SST range (see, smell, taste) is designed to fine-tune the performance of specific wines
These tulip-shaped crystal goblets are perfect for the cream, fruit, and tannins of the naked chardonnay
cons: They are also lightweight, so they need to be handled with extra care

customer_reviews.title: l like them
customer_reviews.text: Apparently, some people don't like the stems on these. I do. A long time ago I used to work at The Olive Garden. These are the same wine glasses you'd get at that restaurant. They're tall. Well, hello, they're wine glasses. Because of their shape, my dishwasher has a hard time cleaning them thoroughly. But that's alright. I re-rinse them by hand. If you use a rinse aid, they come out looking great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Update*** Nope
customer_reviews.text: Amazon made things right as they always do. They gave me a full refund and i ordered a new set. They also let me keep the one glass that was ok. I hope the new order comes in fine. I like the glass that was not damaged. I just realized. One of my glasses came defected. I'm seriously mad. I can't find a good wine glasses. $59 bucks and still no good.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs Mrabet

customer_reviews.title: Very happy!!

customer_reviews.text: These glasses are a bit pricey. That said, they are of very high quality, and are worth every bit of the price if a good quality wine glass is what you're after. I have ordered 4 of these so far, and will probably buy more in order to have a complete set for dinners. Would highly recommend.

customer_reviews.title: The perfect  wine glass.
customer_reviews.text: These wine glasses are awesome! You can use them with any type of wine, of course, even though are made for "white wine." Probably the best design I have come across in years.
customer_reviews.author: L. McCoy

customer_reviews.title: Quality glassware for the most discriminating wine drinker.
customer_reviews.text: I’m not real sure the benefits of the different style glasses for different reds. Sure red’s and white benefit from a different style, but even looking at the picture, the Shiraz and the Cab glasses look pretty darn similar, and the Pinot glasses shape is about the same, just a bit shorter. That said, these are some fine quality glasses. They are thin and delicate feeling, which is always a sign of good glassware. They are nice and large, so if you’re like my mother that means less trips back to the bottle. The price is good for name brand. Your guests will have no doubt that you are a wine connoisseur as they sip out of these beauties.
customer_reviews.author: Bargn Hntr

customer_reviews.title: Amateur wine aficionado loves these glasses
customer_reviews.text: Everything I know about wine I learned from the documentary SOMM, which was brilliant. The only problem is, I've forgotten a lot of it. For the most part, I drink red wine in your standard glasses for that type and in spite of my lack of expertise, I can tell you that this set of (two) glasses is an excellent value. The wine kinda grabs the sides of the glass and holds on (in an attractive way), they also have a nice heft. Inexpert claim: these glasses are of excellent quality for the price. I'd buy them for my more skilled than I am at understanding wine friends.
customer_reviews.author: JuLee Rudolf

customer_reviews.title: Classy Glasses
customer_reviews.text: These are beautiful cabernet wine glasses. The bowl is deep and allows the aroma to seep up to create a lovely nose. If you swirl to see legs this is a deep enough bowl to do that. The rim is a perfect feeling for your lips, not too thin and fragile but not so fine that it feels breakable like some fine crystal. The only drawback for me is the base is too wide to fit in the cupholder built into my sofa. I have no problem storing these in my cabinets even though they are taller than my other wine glasses.
customer_reviews.author: Lynne Hersh

customer_reviews.title: Nice design and sturdier than other Riedel models
customer_reviews.text: As noted, the design is attractive both aesthetically and in terms of having the proper shape for the Cabernet wine. While they say they're dishwasher safe, I wouldn't do it. But still, I have no doubt that they're sturdier than most other Riedel glasses I've used (and I've used plenty). A solid, quality product and a step in a good new direction for Riedel. 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: B.Willis

customer_reviews.title: Wine tastes better in a pretty glass
customer_reviews.text: I’m very pleased with these beautiful Cabernet glasses. The quality of the glassware is very good. I’m so pleased with these glasses. They make wine tasting a special event, as it should be. I handwash and dry because they are delicate glasses, but don’t let that keep you from trying them. They are just heaven.
customer_reviews.author: Leah Maines, best-selling, award-winning author, actor, and editor

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Love these, very high quality, once you see them you will understand why Riedel has the reputation it does. Five stars.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely lovely and they come nicely packaged. They make a great gift.
customer_reviews.author: David S.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, beautiful and large glasses - great for aromatic reds!
customer_reviews.text: Although it was a bit of a pain since one of them arrived broken (Amazon's fault, not the maker), I really LOVE this glass! I mainly drink reds and prefer a classic Italian styled wine... nice, interesting edges and flavors while being super smooth. You need a really good glass to get the aroma and taste right so that it's perfectly aired out. This glass seems to do an excellent job in all areas, plus they are super high quality crystal glasses that should last a lifetime (well, barring my own clutziness or Amazon's shipping methods! Haha!)
customer_reviews.author: Mommymemommy

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely beautiful
customer_reviews.text: The glasses are delicate and beautifully shaped. I'm far from a wine expert so I really can't say that the glasses make my wine taste any better but it definitely enhances the experience. The glass has a wide bowl that tapers at the top so it leaves plenty of room in the glass to aerate the wine and allow the aroma to waft up while you're sipping. I wish I had a rack to hang my wine glasses as these are fairly large and they take up a lot of space in my cabinets but that doesn't diminish my overall opinion of how great they are. I would recommend these to any cabernet lover.
customer_reviews.author: Monie Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Makes a difference
customer_reviews.text: These wine glasses are very high quality, they are quite thin and light but still feel strong. I'm no connoisseur but could definitely tell the difference when using these glasses instead of a more standard wine glass.
customer_reviews.author: Kat Hooper

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality.
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised to see on the box that these can be washed in the dishwasher. I think I will hand wash them. They feel too thin to survive the dishwasher.
